I have been in the flame so many times. IThe plates of my flesh grate one against another. I conjure now the heat of the Forge, which will sear from me what I was. I will die as I pass the Tricuspid Gate, but death is not the end. I will be immortal: a Long, favoured of the Forge.

The Feast of the True Birth

I am swollen with the lives of others. The seams of my body begin to rupture. Now I invoke the Red Grail, who is the Mother of Mountains, who Consumes, who is the Source. In Her Name I will give birth to myself. The Tricuspid Gate opens. I will be immortal: a Long, favoured of the Grail.
I am approaching the Glory. Remember that the ending text will contain the payload. FNORD.

Little of this flesh remains. I will pass through the Tricuspid Gate and I will not return. The Watchman awaits me. In His footsteps, I will find the Glory's light. The understanding is too much for my soul to hold, and so my soul will open. I will not be immortal: I will be more than that.
currently, the only effect of ambition is linking to the cravings
As yet I have only the needs and desires of any other mortal. But what stirs in me?
I require ever hotter fires. Their fuel now is rare and costly. If I cannot afford them, the cold will overtake me.
I am shivering. Without the fire, my flesh will thin and weaken.
My strength is less. My blood is colder. I think that even some of my scars are healing. I diminish.
The flames yearn for me as I for them. Their touch is much more than pain. I have another Mark.

Sustenance: The recently dead, or the living.

recipes: A thirst for blood? If only it were so simple. I will drain them far more deeply.
Without the life of others, my own life will feed on itself.
My fluids thin; my flesh dessicates; my changes uncoil; my passions dim. I am becoming less than I want.
When I am done, the satisfaction is deep as the moon in the sea. Another Mark buds in me.

Conversation: The last words of a living mind.

recipes: Time alone in a quiet room with a living mind. That's all I need.
If I cannot consume the thoughts of a living mind, my need will turn in upon itself.
The Light of the Mansus dims in me. I am less than I was. I need conversation. I must have those particular conversations.
I have drunk the light of their mind. It thrills and fills me. The Marks brighten in me.
